intro: Seseli pelliotii, commonly known as the Pelliot's seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Seseli pelliotii is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
